alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Perry; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 11:23PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lewis, northern Wayne and southern Perry Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1122 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Decaturville, or 12 miles southwest of Linden, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hohenwald, Waynesboro, Clifton, Flatwoods and Gordonsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
